poem:
Title: The Caregiver's Dilemma

Burdens shared,  
Coins in the pocket yet sparse. 
A budding daffodil,  
Bowed beneath a wintry yoke. 

In the registrar's wrath,  
Unseen – unheard,
the echo of human heartbeats.

Where is kindness 
in this world of crunched numbers? 

Beneath the tally, 
In the overlooked crevice,  
Lives the unstinting caregiver, 
their toil a silent anthem.
